hints.label: conj-ldp-mean-field
hints.title: Large Deviations Principle for Mean-Field Limit (Unproven)
hints.content:
81: :label: conj-ldp-mean-field
82: 
83: As $N \to \infty$, the empirical measure $\mu_N = \frac{1}{N} \sum_{i=1}^N \delta_{(x_i, v_i)}$ is conjectured to satisfy a large deviations principle with rate function:
84: 
85: $$
86: I(\rho) = \begin{cases}
87: D_{\text{KL}}(\rho \| \rho_\infty) & \text{if } \rho \ll \rho_\infty \\
88: +\infty & \text{otherwise}
89: \end{cases}
90: $$
91: 
92: This means deviations from the mean-field limit $\rho_\infty$ would be exponentially suppressed with probability $\sim e^{-N \cdot D_{\text{KL}}}$.
93: 
94: **Status**: This LDP has **not been proven** for systems with state-dependent killing and proportional revival. Standard LDP results (Dawson-Gärtner, Dupuis-Ellis) apply to conservative systems or systems with fixed jump rates, not QSD-conditioned dynamics.
